ProductData.DataName: OMPS Nadir Profile IP Product Profile

Datum.Description: Normalized radiance value for 380 nm wavelength
Total column sensor N values for the 340, 331, 318, and 312 nm channels
13 Wavelengths of Observation
Total ozone amount derived from the A-pair of wavelengths
A pair sensitivity
A pair average reflectivity
A pair weight (weighting factor in TOZ calc)
Total ozone amount derived from the B-pair of wavelengths
B pair sensitivity
B pair average reflectivity
B pair weight (weighting factor in TOZ calc)
Best estimate total ozone
Total ozone amount derived from the C-pair of wavelengths
Pressure of reflecting surface
Best Reflectivity from retrieval
C pair sensitivity
Error flag - indicates error in retrieval
Table Selection Index; 0 = Low Latitude; 1 = Mid Latitude; 2 = High Latitude
Snow/Ice Code
Terrain (ground) pressure
Total ozone amount derived from the D-pair of wavelengths
Sulfur Dioxide Index
Total ozone amount derived from the B Prime Pair of wavelengths
N values interpolated from the radiances from the 145 wavelengths of the NP sensor to the SBUV/2 wavelengths (for SBUV/2 were the photometer values)
N values interpolated from the radiances from the 147 wavelengths of the NP sensor to the SBUV/2 profiling wavelengths (for SBUV/2 were the n-values of the profiling wavelengths)
First guess profile for layers
Total ozone for first guess
Q-Value corrected for multiple scattering and surface reflectivity (listed in order from shorter to longer wavelengths... 255.5 to 317.5 nm)
Initial residues of Q-Values
Correction to Q-Values (pressure levels) for the five longer wavelength channels due to Multiple Scattering and Reflectivity (MSR); Listed from shorter to longer wavelength
Monochromator reflectivities for the five longer wavelengths; Listed from shorter to longer wavelength (297.5nm to 317.5nm)
Multiple scattering sensitivity for five longer wavelength (297.5 to 317.5 nm)
Multiple scattering mixing fraction - The mixing fraction which parameterizes contributions of lower and higher latitude profiles in determination of MSR radiance from lookup tables
Final residues of Q-Values (percent) derived using obtained from final solution profile; Listed from shorter to longer wavelength (255.5nm to 317.5nm)
Solution profile individual ozone amounts (matm-cm) in 12 SBUV layers (SBUV layer 1 first)
Standard deviations for solution profile individual ozone amounts (%) in 12 SBUV layers
Total ozone for solution profile (above 1 atm)
Total ozone error code (0 =Good Ascending, 10=Good Descending)

Sigma parameter for c-sigma calculation. Represents the ratio of atmospheric scale height to the ozone scale height in C-Sigma validity check; Sigma should range from 0.3 to 0.8 or an error code is assigned.
Volume mixing ratio (from spline interpolation) of ozone at 19 pressure levels in order of increasing atmospheric pressure (0.3 mb to 100 mb)
Standard deviations of first guess (a priori) profile individual ozone amounts (%) in 12 layers (SBUV layer 1 first)
Standard deviations for Q-values corrected for multiple scattering and reflectivity (255.5 nm through 317.5 nm) in %
Number of iterations for profile solution

Volcano Contamination Index (VCI): Can be used to whether the derived profiles below 5 mb are incorrect because of scattering by aerosols. VCI are in units of the climatological standard deviation of the tropospheric ozone value for a given latitude.
D pair sensitivity
B Prime pair sensitivity
Spacecraft within South Atlantic Anomaly (extent in percent based on Climatological data)
Sun glint indication (scattering angle and surface type thresholds)
All or part of the IFOV is affected by a solar eclipse, umbra or penumbra viewing.
